fi.ak.dungeongen.util

Class FloodFill

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.ak.dungeongen.util.FloodFill

  • public class FloodFill
extends Object
    Class provides a flood-fill algorithm to check if all rooms in a level existing in a char[][] is fully connected.

    • Constructor Summary

      FloodFill(char[][] baseMap, Location stairsDown, Location stairsUp)

      • setNewMap

        public void setNewMap(char[][] newMap,
                      Location stairsDown,
                      Location stairsUp)
        Method sets the flood-fill to use a new map including stairs as locations.
        Parameters:
        newMap - new map to be flood-filled.
        stairsDown - location for stairs down.
        stairsUp - location for stairs up.

      • start

        public void start()
        Method starts flood-filling a level from stairs down.

      • checkFill

        public boolean checkFill()
        Method checks if flood-fill successfully traversed the whole level.
        Returns:
        true if whole level was traversed, false otherwise.

      • getRandomFloorTile

        public Location getRandomFloorTile()
        Method finds a random floor tile.
        Returns:
        location for a random floor tile.

      • isTraversable

        public boolean isTraversable(Location location)
        Method checks if a location has a tile that can be moved on.
        Parameters:
        location - location being inspected
        Returns:
        boolean true if location can be moved on, otherwise false.

      • getStairsDown

        public Location getStairsDown()
                       throws Exception
        Method finds and returns location where stairs are.
        Returns:
        location of the stairs down..
        Throws:
        Exception - if stairs are not found.
